intro: Origanum pulchrum, commonly known as the beautiful oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, woody stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow, slightly hairy, and have a strong, pungent scent when crushed. Origanum pulchrum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and culinary uses.
